To create and edit query configurations dynamically, you must configure the JT_Tooling_API Named Credential:
The framework uses the Tooling API to create Custom Metadata records programmatically. Without this, you can only create configurations manually via Setup → Custom Metadata Types.
Find JT_Tooling_API (should be deployed with the package)
Edit the Named Credential and set the URL to your org's instance (e.g., https://yourinstance.salesforce.com)
For Authentication, select "Named Principal" with "No Authentication"

BETWEEN operator is not supported in Salesforce SOQL.
Instead of: WHERE Field BETWEEN :min AND :max
Please use: WHERE Field >= :min AND Field <= :max

labels.shortDescription: Error - NOT LIKE operator not supported
labels.value:
NOT LIKE operator is not supported in Salesforce SOQL.
Instead of: WHERE Field NOT LIKE :pattern
Please use one of these alternatives: 1. WHERE NOT (Field LIKE :pattern) 2. Apex filtering after query execution

Your query contains operators not supported by Salesforce SOQL: {0}
Please refer to Salesforce SOQL documentation for supported operators.

• SFDX
  • Lightning Data Service (LDS)
  • Lightning Web Components Recipes
  • Dev Hub and Scratch Orgs
  • LWC Local Development Beta
  • Lightning Locker

ó Salesforce-CLI

Es un cliente de línea de comandos que permite descargar, actualizar, crear metadata por medio de una serie de instrucciones


Ejemplo:
sfdx force:lightning:component:create -n myFirstWebComponent -d force-app/main/default/lwc --type lwc

Pero para facilitarnos la vida, tenemos las extensiones de VSCode

¿Se pregunta si puede mantener sus componentes de Aura existentes?
La respuesta es: Sí!

Pueden usar LWC sin renunciar a sus componentes existentes. Es probable que eventualmente se migren sus componentes existentes al modelo Lightning Web Component.


De hecho, los componentes de Aura pueden contener componentes web Lightning (aunque no al revés). Pero una implementación pura de componentes web Lightning proporciona una encapsulación completa y una adherencia evolutiva a los estándares comunes.


Diferencias

Lightning Web Components es la implementación de Salesforce sobre los nuevos frameworks orientados a los standards modernos del desarrollo web.


Aprovecha custom events, templates, shadow DOM, decorators, modules y otras nuevas construcciones de lenguaje disponibles en ECMAScript 7 en adelante


Los navegadores modernos se basan en estándares web, y los estándares en evolución mejoran constantemente lo que los navegadores pueden presentar a un usuario.
Qué necesito para desarrollar LWC?

SFDX, conocimiento de Javascript ES6+, VSCode y el extension pack de SF preferentemente.

La belleza de adherirse a los estándares web es la simplicidad. Simplemente crea componentes usando HTML, JavaScript y CSS.
  • HTML: estructura para su componente.
  • JavaScript: lógica empresarial central y el manejo de eventos.
  • CSS: estilos


    • Y bueno...

Metadata creation and editing are disabled for safety. These features are only available in development/test environments: Sandbox, Scratch Org, Developer Edition, or Trial.
If you're using Starter or Free Edition (which don't include sandbox), you can enable editing at your own risk:
Enable metadata editing in this production environment

⚠️ SECURITY WARNING: • Changes are immediate (no deployment process) • Affects all users in this production org • No rollback mechanism • Could expose sensitive data if misconfigured • Recommended: Use Setup UI instead (Setup → Custom Metadata Types)

This value replaces ':{0}' in your SOQL query. Example: WHERE Field__c = :{0}
Query execution failed. The user may not have access to the requested objects or fields due to license restrictions or insufficient permissions.
Query executed successfully but returned 0 records. This is a valid result indicating no data matches the query criteria.

The user does not have access to this object. This is typically due to license restrictions. Users with Chatter Free, Guest User, or Community User licenses have limited access to standard Salesforce objects.

The user does not have access to one or more fields in this query. This may be due to license restrictions, field-level security settings, or the field not being available for the user's license type.
The user does not have sufficient access rights to execute this query. The user's license type may not include access to this object or the required fields.
This query cannot be executed due to license restrictions. The user's license type does not include access to the required features or objects.
Query execution failed: {0}. This may be due to license restrictions, insufficient permissions, or field-level security settings.

Security restriction: {0} This is typically due to license limitations. Users with restricted licenses (Chatter Free, Guest User, Community User) have limited access to Salesforce objects and features.

Security exception: The user does not have permission to access this object or fields. This is typically due to license restrictions (e.g., Chatter Free, Guest User, Community User) or insufficient permissions.
Access denied: {0} This is typically due to license restrictions or insufficient permissions. Users with restricted licenses may not have access to Custom Metadata Types or other advanced features.
Access denied: {0} This may be due to license restrictions or insufficient permissions.

Permission error: The user does not have sufficient permissions to execute this query. This is typically due to license restrictions. Users with Chatter Free, Guest User, or Community User licenses have limited access to Salesforce objects and features.

License restriction: The user's license type does not include access to this feature or object. Users with restricted licenses (Chatter Free, Guest User, Community User) have limited access to Salesforce functionality.
Object access denied: The user does not have access to this object. This is typically due to license restrictions or object-level security settings.
Query execution failed: {0}. This may be due to license restrictions, insufficient permissions, or field-level security settings.
